title: BBC Local Live: Birmingham & the Black Country on Wednesday 1 June 2016 - BBC News
summary: birmingham pub bombings : inquests to resume .
birmingham pub bombings : coroner says there 's evidence authorities knew about bombings .
birmingham pub bombings : police chief says 'no prospect ' currently of those responsible being caught .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 're back at 08:00 tomorrow with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather , but keep an eye out here for updates through the evening and into the morning .

documents.title: birmingham historian says high rises 'destroyed neighbourhoods '
text: the development of high rise tower blocks across the west midlands `` destroyed neighbourhoods '' , according to a social historian .
professor carl chinn , from birmingham university , said the pace of housing change in communities during the 1960s was probably too quick .
professor chinn made his comments in an interview with presenter adrian chiles during the programme living in '66 - making the midlands .
it 's on bbc one west midlands at 19:30 tonight .

documents.title: pub bombings inquests to be reopened
text: pub bombings inquests to be reopened

documents.title: eu referendum war of words becomes a numbers game
text: my latest blog post examines the more or less reliable stats being traded between the leave and remain campaigns as the final run-up to polling day in the eu referendum draws near .
immigration remains front and centre .
so i go in search of some more reliable numbers to shed light on how eu migration affects communities here .
it 's our talking point on this weekend 's sunday politics at 11:00 on sunday on bbc one .
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: pub bombings victim 's son : inquests 'game-changing '
text: paul thrupp whose father was killed in the birmingham pub bombings says the decision to resume victims ' inquests is a `` game-changer '' that will help his family `` come to terms '' with their grief .
mr thrupp was in his teens when dad trevor was killed aged 33 .
he said reopening the inquests was `` the first step forward for many years '' .
`` the whole process for the family in terms of coming to terms with our grief will be aided by the reopening of the inquests . ''

documents.title: coming up on tv
text: the families of those who died in the birmingham pub bombings say the senior coroner 's decision to re-open the inquests is momentous .
they believe there 's much we do n't know about the bombings , much that remains hidden - perhaps deliberately - by the authorities .
and these fresh inquests they see as a chance to get answers , and even some kind of justice .
join us for the midlands today on bbc one at 18:30 for more on this story .

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : west midlands police 's 'biggest failing '
text: the chief constable of west midlands police , dave thompson , says `` falsification of evidence '' and the perpetrators of the birmingham pub bombings not being caught is the `` biggest failing in the force 's history '' .

speaking after a coroner 's decision to resume inquests into the deaths of 21 people more than 40 years after the attacks that claimed their lives , mr thompson said a lack of evidence meant the force was unable to find those responsible .
he said the focus of the coroner 's investigation was whether there was anything west midlands police could have done to prevent `` this terrible outrage '' .
`` i support an open and transparent approach to examining that . ''

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast for the west midlands
text: into this evening the rain eventually dies away .
lows of 9c ( 48f ) .
it will become drier from tomorrow .
find out more .

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : victims ' families have been 'lied to for decades '
text: marc reeves , editor of the birmingham post and mail , has said today 's ruling to resume the inquests for the victims of birmingham 's pub bombings is `` not a victory in itself '' but he hopes the process will allow victims ' families the chance to move on .
he said : `` this is is about truth and clarity for the 21 because frankly over the past 40 years they have been lied to . ''

documents.title: england in 1966 : racism and ignorance in the west midlands
text: fifty years ago a groundbreaking documentary shone a spotlight on to a west midlands town as racial tensions reached boiling point .
two years on from arguably the most racist election campaign in british history , people were continuing to shun their new black and asian neighbours .
smethwick , in 1966 , was a community divided .
landlords would not let their houses to them .
churches closed their doors to well-dressed families , so as not to upset the white congregation .
and - as a 1966 bbc documentary showed - even haircuts were off limits as racist barbers refused to let immigrants into their salons .

the programme , smethwick : a straw in the wind , highlighted the attitudes of people who were furious at the influx of the thousands of foreigners who had travelled over to the midlands to find work in factories .
author: Rebecca Woods
BBC News Online, Journalist

documents.title: latest : pub bombings inquests to resume ; campaigner calls decision 'seismic ' ; 'new evidence ' to be publicly shared
text: here 's a round-up of the main developments in the pub bombings story :
- the inquests into the deaths of 21 people are to be resumed more than 40 years after the bombings that claimed their lives
- campaigners have called the decision 'seismic '
- senior coroner louise hunt said there was evidence the authorities knew in advance about the bombings

documents.title: aston villa : dr tony xia 's takeover of club not in doubt
text: aston villa 's takeover by chinese businessman dr tony xia is not on the verge of collapse .
it has been reported that xia has failed to demonstrate he possesses the necessary funds to complete the deal .
but bbc sport has learned £ 52m has been paid into an escrow account , ready to be transferred to current villa owner randy lerner .
author: Pat Murphy
BBC Midlands football reporter

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : force will be 'held to account ' on pledge to support renewed inquests
text: the west midlands police and crime commissioner says the force will be held to account on pledges to co-operate with the inquests .
david jamieson said : `` i sincerely hope the inquests brings the answers the families of the victims have been seeking .
`` the chief constable has assured me west midlands police will co-operate fully with the inquests and i will hold the chief constable to account to deliver on that assurance .
`` west midlands police had no principled objection to the resumption of the inquests .
that was a position i supported . ''

documents.title: fight against the development of sutton coldfield green belt continues
text: birmingham city council plans to build up to 6,000 new homes on the sutton coldfield green belt have been put on hold by a government housing minister .
author: Sutton Coldfield Local

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : the full toll
text: the birmingham pub bombings - the worst terrorist attack on the british mainland until the london 7/7 atrocities - left 182 injured and , here , 21 dead .

documents.title: infamous brierley hill rubbish mountain finally coming down
text: it has dominated the skyline in part of brierley hill for seven years but gradually the waste mountain is beginning to reduce in size .
author: Express and Star

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : campaigner talks of 'seismic ' decision
text: a campaigner who lost her sister in the 1974 birmingham pub bombings has described a decision to resume inquests into 21 deaths as 'seismic'.julie hambleton , who has led calls for a public inquiry into the attacks , was 11 when her 18 year old sister , maxine , was killed while handing out party invitations in a pub .

documents.title: 'accelerant ' poured through letterbox at home of woman and her daughter
text: a 75-year-old woman and her daughter were caught in a burning house after `` accelerant '' was poured through their letterbox , the fire service said .
crews rushed to the property following the suspected arson attack at a property in riches street , newbridge , wolverhampton shortly before 03:00 .
they found the pensioner and her 50-year-old daughter trapped in a bedroom .
both were taken to hospital for precautionary check-ups after breathing in smoke .
firefighters rescued 2 women from burning house after suspected # wolverhampton arson attack .

documents.title: q & a : birmingham pub bombings inquests to reopen
text: many of the families regard the inquests as their last chance to find out exactly what happened on the night of 21 november , 1974 .
six men were convicted and then acquitted of the atrocity and no-one has since been convicted of involvement in the bombing , which is widely attributed to the ira .
the move to reopen the inquests follows a campaign by the justice 4 the 21 campaign group , led by family members of victims .
find out more .

documents.title: ex-ira man : birmingham pub bombers will never be convicted
text: the ira 's former director of intelligence has said the men who bombed birmingham in 1974 will never be convicted .
kieran conway , who now works as a lawyer in dublin , said the bombers would never hand themselves over to british police .
in an interview with the bbc , he said he was `` absolutely shocked and appalled '' by the bombings , which had not been sanctioned by the ira leadership .
a total of 21 people died in two city centre pubs on 21 november 1974 .
author: Phil Mackie
Midlands correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: cricket : edgbaston wins five fixtures for 2017 champions trophy
text: the fixtures for the 2017 icc champions trophy have been announced .
warwickshire 's home ground edgbaston has five matches , including four group games and a semi-final .
on 2 june , new zealand face australia in a day-night game and on 4 june india face pakistan in one of the game 's great rivalries .
on 7 june south africa play pakistan in a day-night game and on 10 june it 's england against australia .
the semi-final is on 15 june .
author: Nick Clitheroe
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: coming up on tv
text: i 'll have all the latest on the decision to resume inquests for the victims of the birmingham pub bombings .
join me on bbc one for the midlands today at 13:30 .
author: Giles Latcham
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : 'cover-up ' claims by wrongly convicted man
text: a man wrongly convicted of the birmingham pub bombings says a decision to reopen inquests into the deaths is a first step to finding the truth .
belfast man paddy hill was convicted along with five other people of the 1974 bombings which killed 21 people .
those convictions were quashed in 1991 .
he accused the `` judiciary , the government and the birmingham police '' of `` a massive cover-up '' .

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : no prospect currently of finding the culprits - police chief
text: more on the birmingham pub bombings .
west midlands police 's chief constable dave thompson has said currently he can not see those responsible being brought to justice .
he said : since 2012 and directly as a result of the campaign by families of those who died we have carefully reassessed the opportunities to bring the people responsible to justice .
`` despite an intense scrutiny we have not been able to see , at this time , a prospect of doing this .
that has been an authentic and painstaking search for the truth .
we have not nor will not close this investigation . ''

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : families and campaigners 'refused to give up '
text: councillor john clancy , leader of birmingham city council , has credited the `` persistence '' of the victim 's families and campaigners for today 's decision to reopen inquests for the victims of the birmingham pub bombings .
he said : `` they 've refused to give up and deserve to know exactly what happened on that tragic night back in 1974 .
their fight continues but this is a momentous step in the right direction . ''

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : west midlands police 'supports the resumption of inquests '
text: west midlands police 's chief constable dave thompson said the force `` supported today 's decision .
he said : `` the birmingham pub bombings of 1974 are one of the most serious terrorist attacks in the uk .
west midlands police not only failed to catch those responsible but caused a miscarriage of justice .
i have said and reiterate again , it is the most serious failing in this force 's history . ''
he added : west midlands police will support this inquiry as we have done through the recent hearings by the coroner which determined whether the inquest should re-open .
i hope the new inquest provides answers to families . ''

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : 'anything is possible ' after today 's decision
text: the families are not yet sure what the reopening of inquests means for the future , but julie hambleton hoped there would be no attempt to appeal today 's decision .
julie hambleton : 'our relatives did n't ask to be murdered .
we are now hoping for the truth .
the fight goes on '
author: Kathryn Stanczyszyn
Political Reporter, BBC WM

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : the truth is 'fundamental '
text: the families of the victims of the birmingham pub bombings have been reacting to this morning 's development .
campaigner julie hambleton ( top ) , whose 18-year-old sister maxine ( bottom ) died in the attacks , said : `` the truth is fundamental .
`` like hillsborough they have the truth and now they want accountability .
`` that is how we see our line of inquiry . ''

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : how the atrocity unfolded
text: today 's ruling by birmingham 's senior coroner louise hunt follows years of campaigning by relatives of those who lost their lives after bombs detonated in birmingham on 21 november , 1974 .
this is how the atrocity unfolded that day :
- at 20:17 gmt a bomb exploded in a duffel bag in the mulberry bush pub in the rotunda , birmingham , killing 10 people
- ten minutes later , at 20:27 , a second bomb went off in the tavern in the town , killing 11 more and injuring 182
- a third bomb outside a bank on hagley road failed to explode

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : 'first step on the road to truth '
text: paddy hill , one of the so-called birmingham six , the men whose convictions for the bombings were quashed , has reacted to the announcement the inquests for the 21 victims will resume .
he said this was `` the first step on the road to hopefully getting a bit nearer the truth '' .
`` whether we get the whole truth or not , i 'm not so sure . ''

documents.title: pub bombings inquests to resume : outcome may be inconclusive
text: amid the coroner 's ruling that the inquests will reopen more than 40 years later , a note of caution was sounded : the outcome of the inquests may yet be inconclusive .
author: Phil Mackie
Midlands correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: pub bombings inquests to resume : the families 'looked almost stunned '
text: it will take time to get all the evidence together for an inquest .
the secret service and others involved have been asked to hand over what [ evidence ] they have .
there will be further hearings for evidence to be gathered .
looking at the families when the ruling was made , they looked almost stunned .
author: Phil Mackie
Midlands correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : enough evidence to resume inquests
text: birmingham 's senior coroner louise hunt said she had heard enough evidence over the past six months that warranted being put into the public domain .
there was emotion from the families as she made her ruling .
she said there was evidence the authorities knew there was going to be some kind of bombing in birmingham .
she said , although that was not completely conclusive , there was evidence authorities were warned on two separate occasions and that was enough to reopen the inquests nearly 42 years later .
author: Kathryn Stanczyszyn
Political Reporter, BBC WM

documents.title: pub bombing inquests to resume : victims ' deaths 'can be explained '
text: `` it is still possible to ascertain how the 21 came to their deaths '' the coroner says .
author: Phil Mackie
Midlands correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : 'wealth of evidence ' should be heard publicly
text: the coroner says there 's a wealth of evidence still available that 's not been seen before .
she says it now needs to be heard publicly .
author: Phil Mackie
Midlands correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: breakingbirmingham pub bombings : inquests 'should resume '
text: 'there is a wealth of evidence that still has not been heard - i have decided the inquest should resume '

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : 'missed opportunity ' on advanced warning
text: the senior coroner louise hunt said she has received information about the possibility that the authorities had advanced warning of the bombings .
she says days before the bombings two men were overheard to say birmingham would be bombed `` next week '' .
she says the remarks were reported to the police but that the report was `` filed away '' with no evidence any action was taken .
she says this may have been a `` missed opportunity '' .
author: Giles Latcham
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : families ' call for inquests ' resumption 'has three strands '
text: the call for the inquests to be resumed is based on three strands .
coroner says families ' case has 3 strands - evidence that state had advanced notice , a cover up by wmp , & the emergency response inadequate
author: Kathryn Stanczyszyn
Political Reporter, BBC WM

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : coroner explains criteria to be satisfied for reopening inquests
text: the families listen as coroner sets out reasons an inquest can be reopened - whether the public interest has been adequately served .
author: Kathryn Stanczyszyn
Political Reporter, BBC WM

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : latest
text: here 's reporter phil mackie
part 1 of her ruling coroner louise hunt says she does have the power to resume the # birminghampubbomb inquests

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : senior coroner 's ruling whether to reopen inquests expected
text: julie hambleton , a victim 's sister who has spearheaded the campaign to reopen inquests for the birmingham pub bombings dead , has her head bowed as senior coroner louise hunt reads out the names of the 21 killed .
mrs hunt called the event a `` terrible atrocity resulting in multiple deaths of innocent people '' .
author: Kathryn Stanczyszyn
Political Reporter, BBC WM

documents.title: fa to lead study into brain disease in footballers
text: the football association will lead a study into possible links between football and brain diseases .
the family of former england , west brom and notts county striker jeff astle has campaigned for research since he died from brain trauma in 2002 .
a coroner described his illness as an `` industrial disease '' , in reference to him heading leather balls .

documents.title: witness appeal over aston gunshots
text: gunshots were fired at a house in aston in the early hours of monday , police have revealed .
the force said `` several rounds '' were fired at the park lane property at around 03:30 but nobody was injured .
officers are appealing for anyone with information to phone 101 .

documents.title: football : whitney in the managerial saddle at walsall
text: walsall have appointed jon whitney as the club 's first team manager .
he has signed a three-year deal .
author: BBC WM Sport

documents.title: weather : here 's your morning forecast
text: what does the first day of june have in store ?
author: Kay Crewdson
Weather presenter

documents.title: archers actor alan devereux , who played sid perks , dies
text: actor alan devereux , who played the role of sid perks in the bbc radio 4 soap opera the archers for nearly 50 years , has died .
the 75-year-old died of natural causes on sunday after a short illness .
the character sid arrived on the show as a young tearaway from birmingham on 30 september 1963 and remained in the drama until his death in 2010 .

documents.title: latest : pub bombings inquest ruling due ; crash victim named ; archers actor dies
text: here are the top stories on tuesday so far :
- a ruling is expected later on whether to resume inquests for the victims of the birmingham pub bombings
- a motorcyclist who died in a crash in dudley on sunday has been named by police
- the actor who played sid perks in the archers for nearly 50 years has died
author: Alex Homer
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teenager who died in dudley crash named by police
text: a 17-year-old boy who died in a crash in dudley at the weekend has been named by police as brandon holt .
the teenager was taken to hospital after his motorbike collided with a car on wrens nest road at around 06:15 on sunday , but he died later that day .

documents.title: birmingham pub bombings : coroner to rule on resuming inquests
text: a coroner is due to rule on whether the inquests into the deaths of 21 people in the birmingham pub bombings will resume .
hearings , opened days after the 1974 attacks , were not continued after the jailing of six men , whose convictions were later quashed .
after the men 's release in 1991 the families of those who died began a campaign to get the inquests heard .
coroner louise hunt is expected to deliver her decision later .

documents.title: travel : birmingham train delays warning
text: there are delays of up to 15 minutes on london midland trains between spring road and tyseley due to a signalling problem , commuters are warned .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from local live for birmingham and the black country
text: hello , i 'll be bringing you tuesday 's news , sport , travel and weather updates .
if you see something you think we should be covering , or have captured a photograph you want to show off , email us , tweet us or reach us on our facebook page .
author: Alex Homer
BBC Local Live
